sub_topic: Finding the phase shift of trigonometric functions
message_1: A sinusoidal wave given by the equation y = 2sin(3x + π/4) is shifted 5 units to the right. What is the new equation of the wave?
message_2:
To shift the sinusoidal wave 5 units to the right, we need to replace x with (x - 5) in the argument of the sine function. The new equation of the wave will be:

y = 2sin(3(x - 5) + π/4)

Simplify the equation:

y = 2sin(3x - 15 + π/4)
